title: Add “Supporter of the community” profile flag + directory filter (frontend)

requirements.summary: Add “Supporter of the community” toggle to My Profile Mentorship section and save/load it with the community profile.
acceptanceCriteria: The ProfileMe edit form shows a third toggle/switch labeled exactly “Supporter of the community” in the same section as the other mentorship toggles.
When a user toggles “Supporter of the community” and saves, the value persists and is restored on reload.
In ProfileMe view mode, the Mentorship summary area includes “✓ Supporter of the community” when the flag is enabled.

file_operations.description: Extend local form state to include supporterOfCommunity, initialize it from the loaded profile, include it in the CommunityProfile object passed to updateCommunityProfile, add a new Switch+Label control in the Mentorship edit section labeled exactly “Supporter of the community”, and update view-mode mentorship summary rendering to include “✓ Supporter of the community” when true (and ensure the Mentorship block renders when any of the three flags is enabled).

requirements.summary: Add “Supporter of the community” directory filter toggle and show supporter status on directory profile cards.
acceptanceCriteria: Directory filter UI includes a third switch labeled exactly “Supporter of the community”.
Directory queries include the supporterOfCommunity filter value when calling the browse API.
Directory result cards visually indicate supporter status (e.g., a small label similar to the existing “Mentoring” / “Seeking” indicators) when supporterOfCommunity is true.

file_operations.description: Update useBrowseMentors to accept a filters object that includes supporterOfCommunity, and forward that full filters object to browseMentors; also add a guard so if all three filters are false, the query does not fetch and instead returns an empty list (keeping UX consistent with the existing empty-state UI).

Add a third filter Switch+Label labeled exactly “Supporter of the community”, include supporterOfCommunity in the filters passed to useBrowseMentors, and add a third small status indicator on each result card (styled consistently with existing “Mentoring” / “Seeking” indicators) when profile.supporterOfCommunity is true.
